Title: Want a real world Review, here it is...
Body: When I first heard about this stuff, I kinda passed it off. I mean, How many ads do we see for magic pills that don't work? Also, everything I read about it said good for "Joints, Joints, Joints".. but the only "Joint" I could read about from the company or reviews was about knees. My knees are relatively OK. My Right HIP however, lemme tell ya. when I hit 40 I started getting HORRIBLE leg issues where I could not even walk. I was on crutches having to kick my right leg forward to take a step. It would seemingly get better, then flair up again. Turns out it was my Hip. I got x-rays and the synovia fluid around my right hip is a wafer thin layer as compared to my seemingly1/4 thick line around my left. I was told I WILL need hip replacement in my life. But now being only 49, not recommended to get it now.So lemme tell you what I experience.  When my hip decides to be a bastard, it will be totally fine and I will just move a certain way ( which is not a consistent move by the way, its random ) and it feels like the ball in my hip has a shard on it that "catches" the inside of my leg causing extreme pain, and a "locking" sensation. I will then be pain to move or step or do anything for a while then it will just  subside for no reason.. I cannot take a step first with my right leg, if I go up a curb I cannot step up and put the weight of my body on it, I have to go left foot step first. If I find myself on a ladder, I have to step left, bring up my right to same step, step up left...etc.Anyway, I have taken Glucosamine and it "....helped?" I guess but not enough for me to consistently think about and take it regularly enough.SO Ultimately I decided to give this Flexuron a try.the pills have a chocolate look and taste to them to me. Smooth small to medium size and easy to swallow. I decided to take daily around 6-7pm. My result are as follows now going through 1/2 the pack ( 15 days)On third day I started feeling a difference in my hip, it just felt... better.On fourth day I was able to take steps first with my right AND actually step up onto curbs with my right leg sans any pain.by the seventh day ( how many days before you are supposed to feel better ) My hip was feeling real goodEvery day since I am much more able and strong with my hip. It still gets testy once in a while, but even that the frequency and how long the pain lasts is MUCH shorter. I am not healed, but I am CERTAINLY feeling much betterSo, I took a chance for a part of the body I could NOT get to come up in any ad or review that I saw. And I am SOOOOOO glad I did.I don't think it will get me to where I can run, or work out, or do a lot of leg stuff. but it has ABSOLUTLEY brought some quality back to my normal day to day needs.
